intro: Hemistegia decurrens, commonly known as the spreading hemistegia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom during the wet season. Hemistegia decurrens is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
